preclusion:
Students who have read a Freshman Seminar before will be precluded from reading a second Freshman Seminar.

Students staying in Residential Colleges in UTown who will be reading or have read the Junior Seminars will be precluded from reading Freshman Seminar in the Faculty.
description:
Biological materials such as hair/feather, muscle, skin, and
spider silk are mechanically durable and can adapt to
changing environmental conditions. Although the different
materials have distinct mechanical properties and
biological functions and display specific hierarchical
structures, they are constructed mainly from proteins with
universal conserved building blocks. In this seminar series,
we will discuss protein structures at four levels and
interactions involved in the structures. Students will
explore the relationship between the property of a protein
material and the structure of its constituent protein through
independent enquiry, discussion, group projects, and
presentations.
title: Protein materials - composition and property
